Alerts (ui.atomic.alerts)

{{alert.msg | translate }}

Alerts usage documentation: TODO

<div ng-controller="AlertsDemoCtrl">
    <button ng-click="showAlert()">Show alert</button>
    <alert ng-repeat="alert in $root.alerts" type="alert.type" close="$root.closeAlert($index)">
        {{alert.msg | translate }}
    </alert>
</div>
 
function AlertsDemoCtrl($scope) {

    $scope.showAlert = function(){
        $scope.$emit('alert.show', { type: 'danger', msg: 'validationMessage', keep: false })
    }
}

Back (ui.atomic.back)

<div ng-controller="BackDemoCtrl">
    <button data-back >Go back in history</button>
</div>
 
function BackDemoCtrl($scope) {}

Confirm (ui.atomic.confirm)

The confirm-url directive shows a confirmation dialog before calling the url given

API

  • confirm-url : {string} The url that is used to call after confirmation
  • follow-url: {boolean} Should it act as a link and change page ( to the url given in the confirm-delete parameter )

EVENTS

  • "apiEvent.ACTION_SUCCESS" when follow-url is set to false ( does not change page )
<div ng-controller="ConfirmDemoCtrl">
    <button data-confirm-url="/my/url">Show Confirm</button>
</div>
 
function ConfirmDemoCtrl($scope) {}

<div ng-controller="FilterDemoCtrl"></div>
 
function FilterDemoCtrl(){

Full-screen (ui.atomic.full-screen)

Full screen components opens a Modal that adds a touch carousel The pictures shown in the carousel are those defined in the array images

Dependencies

  • infinite-scroll <script src="/components/angularitics/src/angulartics.js"></script>

API - fullscreen : array of images that you want to show in the carousel

Callbacks:

<div ng-controller="FullScreenCtrl">
    <img src="http://lorempixel.com/400/200/" full-screen="images" />
</div>
 
function FullScreenCtrl($scope) {
    $scope.images = [
        {
            url: 'http://lorempixel.com/800/800/'
        },
        {
            url: 'http://lorempixel.com/400/200/'
        },
        {
            url: 'http://lorempixel.com/600/600/'
        },
    ];
}

List (ui.atomic.list)

List creates a paginated list that fetches the data from the server in a paginated order

API - api-url : (string) url where the list is going to obtain the data from ( e.g. "/api/users" ) - api-query : (object) query to be added to the api url in order to filter for the results ( e.g '{}') - list-class : (string) class for the UL element - list-cache (boolean) pager should use cache or not

<div ng-controller="ListDemoCtrl">
    <list data-api-url="/api/entities" data-list-class="media-list">
        <list-item data-ng-repeat="item in pager.results"></list-item>
        <button ng-click="pager.nextPage()">Next Page</button>
    </list>
</div>

function ListDemoCtrl($httpBackend) {
    var firstPage = {
        nbPages: 2,
        nbResults: 2,
        results: [
            {
                title: "First Item",
                description: "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit. Aut, consectetur eius exercitationem inventore ipsam itaque labore magnam nihil non placeat praesentium quidem quod reprehenderit soluta sunt suscipit vero voluptates voluptatibus?",
                imageUrl: "http://www.lorempixel.com/50/50"
            },
            {
                title: "Second Item",
                description: "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit. Aut, consectetur eius exercitationem inventore ipsam itaque labore magnam nihil non placeat praesentium quidem quod reprehenderit soluta sunt suscipit vero voluptates voluptatibus?",
                imageUrl: "http://www.lorempixel.com/50/50"
            }
        ]};
    var secondPage = {
        nbPages: 2,
        nbResults: 2,
        results: [
            {
                title: "Third Item",
                description: "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit. Aut, consectetur eius exercitationem inventore ipsam itaque labore magnam nihil non placeat praesentium quidem quod reprehenderit soluta sunt suscipit vero voluptates voluptatibus?",
                imageUrl: "http://www.lorempixel.com/50/50"
            },
            {
                title: "Fourth Item",
                description: "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit. Aut, consectetur eius exercitationem inventore ipsam itaque labore magnam nihil non placeat praesentium quidem quod reprehenderit soluta sunt suscipit vero voluptates voluptatibus?",
                imageUrl: "http://www.lorempixel.com/50/50"
            }
        ]};

    $httpBackend.whenGET(/^\/api\/entities\?page=1/).respond(firstPage)
    $httpBackend.whenGET(/^\/api\/entities\?page=2/).respond(secondPage)
}

Mailto (ui.atomic.mailto)

Mailto is a directive to send emails via the "mailto://" ptrotocol. It Opens the default mail client installed in your machine

API - data-mailto: Predefined receiver email address. - data-mailto-subject: Predefined subject of the email. - data-mailto-content: Predefined content of the email

Plunker

<div ng-controller="MailtoDemoCtrl">
    <button data-mailto="'developer@testabit.com'"
            data-mailto-subject="This is a subject!"
            data-mailto-content="Hey, great content here!">
        Send email to developer@testabit.com
    </button>
</div>
 
function MailtoDemoCtrl() {

}

Testabit (ui.atomic.testabit)

Demo in plunkr

Dependencies

  • angularitics.js

    <script src="/components/angularitics/src/angulartics.js"></script>

You can add the testabit behaviour to any button by adding the following attributes:

API

  • testabit="modal" (possible values : "silent", "modal")
  • testabit-category="TestCategory" Required. Analytics Category : see how to define your allowed categories in the configuration
  • testabit-action="test.button" Required: Analytics Action : the action name you want to give it
  • testabit-label="Test Label" Required: Analytics Label : the label you want to give it
  • testabit-value=""
<a class="pull-right" href="http://plnkr.co/edit/qDrwU6RVVrJbng9fEbnc">Demo in plunkr</a>
<button data-testabit="modal"
        data-testabit-category="TestCategory"
        data-testabit-action="test.button"
        data-testabit-label="Test Label"
        data-testabit-value="">
    Testabit Button
</button>
 
angular.module('ui.atomic.testabit')
    .config(function (testabitProvider) {
        // Configure the array of your "allowed categories"
        testabitProvider.setCategories([ 'TestCategory']);
        /*   When enabling debug mode ( default ) testabit draws the borders of
         the html element where you are applying the directive
         If the border is red, the directive is missing some parameter
         You can see the error in the console of your browser.
         Set debugMode to false in the prod environment */
        testabitProvider.debugMode = true;
    });

Truncate (ui.atomic.truncate)

{{ 'Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit. A aliquam architecto asperiores distinctio dolor impedit ipsam! Aliquam corporis deserunt dicta dolorem hic ipsum libero, nihil numquam quia reprehenderit sint ullam?' | truncate }}

Truncates a text

<div>
    {{ 'Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit. A aliquam architecto asperiores distinctio dolor impedit ipsam! Aliquam corporis deserunt dicta dolorem hic ipsum libero, nihil numquam quia reprehenderit sint ullam?' | truncate }}
</div>
 
function TruncateDemoCtrl(){

}

</div>
 
function UrlencodeDemoCtrl(){

}

Whatsapp (ui.atomic.whatsapp)

Whatsapp is a directive to send a text via whatsapp using the "whatsapp://" ptrotocol. It is only valid for iOS, if the device is not iOS then the button is hidden ( if you don't see it in this demo is because it is hidden, try openning this page with an iOS device )

Requires <script src="components/angular-adaptive-detection/angular-adaptive-detection.min.js" />

API - data-text: Text to be sent

<button data-whatsapp data-text="This is a text to be shared in whatsapp">Send Whatsapp</button>
 
function WhatsappDemoCtrl(){

}
